intro: Dracontia fortunae, commonly known as the lucky dragon plant, is a unique member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves that resemble dragon scales, giving it its common name. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in warm, humid environments. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is believed to bring good fortune in many cultures.
